reviewText:
Great movie.  Sadly, not pressed, or burned on M-DISC

I completely understand that obscure movies like this may not economically justify pressing a disc.  However, I would have gladly paid a dollar or two more for a disc that would last forever.  Instead, they burned the movie on the old-fashioned, purple dye type disc that are only good for around 5 - 7 years. M-Disc last 100s of years.

This review is for the actual item I received from Amazon. If you are after a, "pure movie review", I suggest you look at the International Movie Database. There you will find many reviews without regard to the delivery mechanism.

This is a Great Movie.  The image quality is excellent. Humorous and well acted.

I used to be able to see this movie every year.
Now I can watch it when ever.
I bought this as I had remembered seeing it as a child. It was not as good as I remembered, but okay. Eddie bracken was good and the "gas wars"  brought back memories of when those things happened.

I saw this movie last in August of 1968, and thought it was hilarious. But - upon viewing it last week, hm, maybe just not so funny. Kinda pathetic, actually. Oh well, many years have passed, my tastes must have changed...
I enjoyed the movie with Mickey Rooney

This very interesting time capsule film represents that late 40's, early 50's period of American optimism. Rooney and Bracken are excellent. The cars, the business ideas, the motorcycles and the girls are great. Worth seeing.
